meanings.definition: Enlist (someone) compulsorily, typically into the armed forces.
meanings.sent1: The army was conscripting new soldiers to join the ranks.
meanings.sent2: During wartime, governments may resort to conscripting citizens for military service.
meanings.sent3: The idea of conscripting all citizens into the army for a day as a surprise event sounds like a chaotic but fun experiment.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against ignorance, education is the weapon conscripting minds to fight for knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The image of the general conscripting brave warriors under the flag of freedom is etched in history.

meanings.sent1: The conscripting of young men into the army was met with mixed feelings.
meanings.sent2: The conscripting process involves selecting individuals for mandatory military duty.
meanings.sent3: At the conscripting office, the atmosphere was tense yet oddly bureaucratic.
meanings.sent4: The conscripting of soldiers from all walks of life creates a diverse military force.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the conscripting horn echoed through the valley, calling all able-bodied men to duty.
